title: Mastering Model Test Shoots: The One-Light Setup Agents Love
summary: Fashion photographer Lindsay Adler breaks down the essentials of a model test shoot, focusing on what agents look for in a portfolio. She demonstrates a simple yet effective one-light setup designed to create a clean, emotive 'front of book' image using a white beauty dish and specific modifications.

steps.action: Consult with the model's agent beforehand to determine specific needs (e.g., beauty shots, commercial smiles, new haircut showcase).
Start the shoot with a simple setup: natural hair, simple makeup, and clean lighting to show the model as a 'clean canvas'.
Set up a white background. A white wall can suffice if seamless paper is unavailable.
Position the key light using a white beauty dish for flattering light with contrast.
Convert the image to Black & White and boost contrast in post-processing to focus on the subject's emotion.
Add a grid to the beauty dish to narrow the light spread, creating a moodier look and darkening the background shadows.
Feather the light by changing the angle or distance to the background to control how light or dark the background appears.
Use a versatile zoom lens to capture both close-ups and wider shots without changing lenses.
steps.tool: Canon EOS R5 Mark II + RF 24-105mm

steps.action: Utilize software sliders for quick skin smoothing or adding grain for a filmic look.
Direct the model to use hands for expression and vary facial emotions.

key_takeaways: A 'test shoot' is for portfolio building; ensure the model, photographer, and agent all benefit.
Agents often prefer simple, clean images ('front of book' shots) that show the model naturally.
Black and white processing helps focus attention on the subject's connection and emotion.
A white beauty dish is a versatile modifier that is flattering but provides good contrast.
Adding a grid to a light source restricts the spill, allowing you to turn a white wall into a dark gray background for drama.
Simple adjustments to light placement (feathering) can drastically change the mood without adding more gear.
